body_html:
@drpngx Thanks for the response!

I tried commenting out all of the Keras imports in my tests, and still got the "Registering" logs.

The log looks like it's coming from https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/framework/registry.py#L64

Let me know if there's any other info I can provide to help debug this! My current hypothesis is that all this logging happens as part of the import tensorflow as tf, before I'm able to set_logging.

One possible workaround is to allow the user to import some very tiny function like set_logging that lets them set logging defaults before importing the rest of tensorflow.

The log looks like it's coming from https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/framework/registry.py#L64
Let me know if there's any other info I can provide to help debug this! My current hypothesis is that all this logging happens as part of the import tensorflow as tf, before I'm able to set_logging.
One possible workaround is to allow the user to import some very tiny function like set_logging that lets them set logging defaults before importing the rest of tensorflow.
body:
@drpngx Thanks for the response! 

I tried commenting out all of the Keras imports in my tests, and still got the "Registering" logs.

The log looks like it's coming from https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/framework/registry.py#L64

Let me know if there's any other info I can provide to help debug this! My current hypothesis is that all this logging happens as part of the `import tensorflow as tf`, before I'm able to set_logging. 

One possible workaround is to allow the user to import some very tiny function like `set_logging` that lets them set logging defaults before importing the rest of tensorflow.
